acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96 hours LC50=8mg/L of the fish (Rainbow Trout) (PDS, 1988).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 179mg/kg (RTECS (2006)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 50mg/kg, calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 40mg/kg (RTECS (2006)), 120mg/kg and 130mg/kg (HSDB (2003)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=3.15(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3018 (Organophosphorous Pesticide, liquid, toxic) (ICSC, 1999)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: No data available, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3018 (Organophosphorous Pesticide, liquid, toxic) (ICSC, 1999)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3018 (Organophosphorous Pesticide, liquid, toxic) (ICSC, 1999)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (RTECS (2006)): "Severe." The substance is classified as Category 1 from the viewpoint of safety.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (RTECS (2006)): "Mild."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies: "red blood cell, white blood cell and amorphous urate crystals were found in the urine" (IPCS PESTICIDE RESIDUES IN FOOD (1979)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system, respiratory system, cardiovascular system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (central nervous system, respiratory system, cardiovascular system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "tremor, spasm, reddish tear, dyspnea," "reduced cholinesterase activity in the brain, heart and adrenal accompanied by sinus bradycardia" (IPCS (1969) EVALUATIONS OF SOME PESTICIDE RESIDUES IN FOOD). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
